filename: Virk et al. - 2023 - RIDDLE ME THIS A RARE CASE OF DIFFUSE PULMONARY MENINGIOTHELIOMAS.pdf

fields_extracted.case_count_quote: In our case, the patient was diagnosed with DPM
fields_extracted.presenting_symptoms_quote: diagnosed with diffuse pulmonary nodules incidentally via CT angiogram chest during inpatient admission for COVID-19 infection
fields_extracted.diagnostic_method: Bronchoscopy with bronchioalveolar lavage (BAL) with transbronchial cryo biopsy
fields_extracted.diagnostic_method_quote: underwent bronchoscopy with bronchioalveolar lavage (BAL) with transbronchial cryo biopsy of lung nodules
fields_extracted.imaging_findings: Numerous sub 6 mm bilateral centrilobular GGNs and solid pulmonary nodules with mild upper lobe predominance
fields_extracted.imaging_findings_quote: CT scan chest 1 year later showed numerous sub 6 mm bilateral centrilobular GGNs and solid pulmonary nodules with mild upper lobe predominance
fields_extracted.histopathology_quote: transbronchial cryo biopsy of lung nodules, which showed MPMNs
fields_extracted.treatment_quote: decision was made for close follow-up with serial CT scans
fields_extracted.outcome_quote: given the complexity of the case, lack of symptoms, and stability of nodules
fields_extracted.comorbidities: Ductal hyperplasia of the breast, common variable immunodeficiency syndrome (CVID), asthma, obstructive sleep apnea, and thyroid follicular cancer
fields_extracted.comorbidities_quote: history of ductal hyperplasia of the breast, common variable immunode /uniFB01 ciency syndrome (CVID), asthma, obstructive sleep apnea, and thyroid follicular cancer
fields_extracted.filename: Virk et al. - 2023 - RIDDLE ME THIS A RARE CASE OF DIFFUSE PULMONARY MENINGIOTHELIOMAS.pdf
fields_extracted.extraction_notes: The case is well-documented with clear quotes supporting most extracted information. Lab values were available but not included as they were part of the diagnostic workup rather than final findings. The outcome is listed as stable based on the decision for observation and mention of stability of nodules.

filename: Kuroki et al. - 2002 - Minute Pulmonary Meningothelial-like Nodules High-Resolution Computed Tomography and Pathologic Cor.pdf

fields_extracted.case_count_quote: A2-cm pulmonary nodule was incidentally discovered on screening chest radiographs in a 55-year-old nonsmoking Japanese woman.
fields_extracted.patient_age_quote: A2-cm pulmonary nodule was incidentally discovered on screening chest radiographs in a 55-year-old nonsmoking Japanese woman.
fields_extracted.patient_sex_quote: A2-cm pulmonary nodule was incidentally discovered on screening chest radiographs in a 55-year-old nonsmoking Japanese woman.
fields_extracted.presenting_symptoms_quote: A2-cm pulmonary nodule was incidentally discovered on screening chest radiographs
fields_extracted.diagnostic_method: Chest radiographs, HRCT, contrast-enhanced chest CT, fiberoptic bronchoscopy with cytology, surgical pathology
fields_extracted.diagnostic_method_quote: Both highresolution CT (HRCT) and routine contrast-enhanced chest CT were obtained (10-mm collimation; WL: -500; WW: 2,000) for staging suspected lung cancer... Fiberoptic bronchoscopy was performed with cytologic examination of material obtained from the dominant tumor in the right upper lobe, suggesting malignancy. A right upper lobectomy was performed
fields_extracted.imaging_findings: 2-cm spiculated nodule in right upper lobe with inhomogeneous enhancement and irregular border, surrounded by ground-glass opacity. Additional tiny nodules of ground-glass attenuation (1-3 mm) in right upper lobe.
fields_extracted.imaging_findings_quote: The nodule was seen in the right upper lobe and showed inhomogeneous enhancement and an irregular border with fine spiculation. The nodule was surrounded by a zone of ground-glass opacity... tiny nodules of ground-glass (1-3 mm in diameter) attenuation in the right upper lobe
fields_extracted.histopathology: Well-differentiated adenocarcinoma (papillary subtype) as main tumor, with additional minute pulmonary meningothelial-like nodules (MPMNs) consisting of cellular proliferations of meningothelial-like cells with round to oval nuclei and indistinct cell borders
fields_extracted.histopathology_quote: The pathologic diagnosis of the main tumor was well-differentiated adenocarcinoma, papillary subtype... The small nodules seen elsewhere in the right upper lobe were found to represent minute pulmonary meningothelial-like nodules (MPMNs). These lesions consisted of cellular proliferations of meningothelial-like cells with round to oval nuclei and indistinct cell borders associated with venules
fields_extracted.immunohistochemistry: Previous studies showed MPMNs are immunoreactive for EMA, vimentin, myosin; negative for cytokeratin, S-100 protein, neuron-specific enolase, and actin
fields_extracted.immunohistochemistry_quote: Gaffey et al. (2) reported that meningothelial-like nodules were immunoreactive for epithelial membrane antigen (EMA) and vimentin and were negative for cytokeratin, S-100 protein, neuron-specific enolase, and actin... Torikata and Mukai (3) reported positive immunoreactivity for myosin and vimentin in all meningothelial-like nodules.
fields_extracted.treatment_quote: A right upper lobectomy was performed with the assumption that the patient had stage IA (T1N0M0) lung cancer.
fields_extracted.outcome: Stable - no change in remaining nodules at 12 months follow-up
fields_extracted.outcome_quote: The lesions showed no change in morphologic characteristics of the ground-glass nodules. Although the lesions seen in the other lobes were not sampled histologically, they were stable for an additional 6-month period.
fields_extracted.comorbidities_quote: Laboratory evaluation showed an elevated carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA) (16.6 ng/mL; normal value: <4.7 ng/mL)
fields_extracted.filename: Kuroki et al. - 2002 - Minute Pulmonary Meningothelial-like Nodules High-Resolution Computed Tomography and Pathologic Cor.pdf
fields_extracted.extraction_notes: The case is well documented with clear imaging, pathological findings and follow-up. The only uncertainty is around the complete immunohistochemistry profile as this was referenced from previous studies rather than directly performed on this patient.

filename: Gleason - 2016 - Meningotheliomatosis A Rare Cause of Diffuse Miliary Pattern Pulmonary Opacities.pdf

fields_extracted.case_count_quote: A 63 year old female presented for incidentally discovered pulmonary nodules.
fields_extracted.patient_age_quote: A 63 year old female presented for incidentally discovered pulmonary nodules.
fields_extracted.patient_sex_quote: A 63 year old female presented for incidentally discovered pulmonary nodules.
fields_extracted.presenting_symptoms_quote: she denied any respiratory complaints including dyspnea, cough or sputum production
fields_extracted.diagnostic_method_quote: transbronchial biopsies revealed many meningothelial like bodies confirming the diagnosis of Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis
fields_extracted.imaging_findings: Innumerable and diffusely distributed nodules up to 4mm in a military type pattern, no mediastinal or hilar adenopathy
fields_extracted.imaging_findings_quote: The Computed Tomography (CT) scan of the chest with contrast showed innumerable and diffusely distributed nodules up to 4mm in a military type pattern. There was no mediastinal or hilar adenopathy
fields_extracted.histopathology: Many meningothelial like bodies confirming Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis
fields_extracted.histopathology_quote: transbronchial biopsies revealed many meningothelial like bodies confirming the diagnosis of Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis
fields_extracted.outcome_quote: Positron Emission Tomography/Computed Tomography (PET/CT) scan of our patient did not reveal abnormalities suggestive of underlying malignancy.
fields_extracted.comorbidities: 10 pack-year smoking history, occupational chemical fume exposure
fields_extracted.comorbidities_quote: Medical, social and family history was remarkable for a 10 pack-year smoking history and occupational chemical fume exposure, working in a compounding pharmacy.
fields_extracted.filename: Gleason - 2016 - Meningotheliomatosis A Rare Cause of Diffuse Miliary Pattern Pulmonary Opacities.pdf
fields_extracted.extraction_notes: All key information is clearly stated in the text with direct quotes available. The case appears to be well documented with clear diagnostic, imaging and histological findings. Treatment information is not explicitly mentioned in the text.
